snippet: The interior designer Howard Slatkin spent nearly three years transforming his prewar co-op into a monument to old-world craft in which he designed every detail, down to the last doorknob.
lead_paragraph: The interior designer Howard Slatkin spent nearly three years transforming his prewar co-op into a monument to old-world craft in which he designed every detail, down to the last doorknob.

headline.main: Inside a Fifth Avenue Pied-à-Terre, an 18th-Century European Palace
